trans-unit.source: Contains information used in asynchronous (or overlapped) input and output (I/O)

seg-source.mrk: Contains information used in asynchronous (or overlapped) input and output (I/O)

target.mrk: Contains information used in asynchronous (or overlapped) input and output (I/O)

trans-unit.source: Reserved for operating system use. This member, which specifies a system-dependent status, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns without setting the extended error information to ERROR_IO_PENDING.

seg-source.mrk: This member, which specifies a system-dependent status, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns without setting the extended error information to ERROR_IO_PENDING.

target.mrk: This member, which specifies a system-dependent status, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns without setting the extended error information to ERROR_IO_PENDING.

trans-unit.source: Reserved for operating system use. This member, which specifies the length of the data transferred, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns True.

seg-source.mrk: This member, which specifies the length of the data transferred, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns True.

target.mrk: This member, which specifies the length of the data transferred, is valid when the GetOverlappedResult function returns True.

trans-unit.source: File position at which to start the transfer. The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.

seg-source.mrk: File position at which to start the transfer.
The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.

target.mrk: File position at which to start the transfer.
The file position is a byte offset from the start of the file.

trans-unit.source: The calling process must set this member before calling the ReadFile or WriteFile function.

seg-source.mrk: The calling process must set this member before calling the ReadFile or WriteFile function.

target.mrk: The calling process must set this member before calling the ReadFile or WriteFile function.

trans-unit.source: This member is used only when the device is a file. Otherwise, this member must be zero.

seg-source.mrk: This member is used only when the device is a file.
Otherwise, this member must be zero.

target.mrk: This member is used only when the device is a file.
Otherwise, this member must be zero.

trans-unit.source: High-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer.

seg-source.mrk: High-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer.

target.mrk: High-order word of the file position at which to start the transfer.

trans-unit.source: This member is used only when the device is a file. Otherwise, this member must be zero.

seg-source.mrk: This member is used only when the device is a file.
Otherwise, this member must be zero.

target.mrk: This member is used only when the device is a file.
Otherwise, this member must be zero.

trans-unit.source: Handle to an event that will be set to the signaled state when the operation has completed.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to an event that will be set to the signaled state when the operation has completed.

target.mrk: Handle to an event that will be set to the signaled state when the operation has completed.

trans-unit.source: The calling process must set this member either to zero or a valid event handle before calling any overlapped functions.

seg-source.mrk: The calling process must set this member either to zero or a valid event handle before calling any overlapped functions.

target.mrk: The calling process must set this member either to zero or a valid event handle before calling any overlapped functions.
